gov.usgs.traveltime

Class UpDataVol

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.traveltime.UpDataVol

  • public class UpDataVol
extends java.lang.Object
    Store volatile up-going branch data for one wave type. Note that all data have been normalized.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

    • Constructor Summary

      UpDataVol(UpDataRef ref, ModDataVol modPri, ModDataVol modSec, ModConvert cvt)
      Set up volatile copies of data that changes with depth.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UpDataVol

        public UpDataVol(UpDataRef ref,
                 ModDataVol modPri,
                 ModDataVol modSec,
                 ModConvert cvt)
        Set up volatile copies of data that changes with depth. Note that both P and S models are needed. If this is handling the up-going data for P, the primary model would be for P and the secondary model would be for S.
        Parameters:
        ref - The up-going reference data source
        modPri - The primary Earth model data source
        modSec - the secondary Earth model data source
        cvt - Model specific conversions

    • Method Detail

      • newDepth

        public void newDepth(double depth)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Correct up-going tau to the desired source depth. The up-going branches are used to correct tau for all ray parameters for all travel-time branches. At the same time, integrals are computed for the largest ray parameter (usually equal to the source depth slowness) needed to correct tau for the largest ray parameter for all branches.
        Parameters:
        depth - Normalized source depth
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the source depth is too deep

      • realUp

        public double[] realUp(double[] pBrn,
                       double[] tauBrn,
                       double[] xRange,
                       double xMin)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate the up-going branch that will be used to compute travel times. The stored up-going branches must be complete in ray parameter samples in order to correct all other travel-time branches to the desired source depth. However, due to the irregular spacing of the ray parameter grid, the interpolation will be unstable. Therefore, the up-going branch must be decimated to be useful later. For very shallow sources, even the decimated grid will be unstable and must be completely replaced.
        Parameters:
        pBrn - Normalized raw ray parameter grid
        tauBrn - Normalized raw tau grid
        xRange - Normalized distance range
        xMin - Normalized minimum distance interval desired
        Returns:
        A new grid of ray parameter values for the up-going branch
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the tau integration fails

      • getDecTau

        public double[] getDecTau()
        Get the decimated tau values associated with the decimated ray parameter grid.
        Returns:
        Decimated, normalized tau on the decimated ray parameter grid

      • dumpCorrUp

        public void dumpCorrUp(boolean full)
        Print out the up-going branch data corrected for the source depth.
        Parameters:
        full - If true print the corrected tau array as well.

      • dumpDecUp

        public void dumpDecUp(boolean full)
        Print out the decimated up-going branch data corrected for the source depth.
        Parameters:
        full - If true print the corrected tau array as well.
